packages.name: FastScripts.glyphsPalette
packages.title: FastScripts
packages.description: Quickly run your favorite scripts from the side panel.

packages.name: EOD.glyphsPalette
packages.title: Explosive Ordnance Disposal
packages.description: EOD is a Glyphs 3 palette designed to improve the efficiency of Chinese font designers. Provides easy-to-use glyph disassembly and analysis functions. See [the repository readme](https://github.com/3type/EOD/) for details.

packages.name: Angularizzle.glyphsFilter
packages.title: Angularizzle
packages.description: *Filter > Angularizzle* disfigures curves by sharp line. Visually it has something akin to Illustrator‚Äôs *Simplify* but is more nuanced. The *Keep detail* option attempts to protect the form‚Äôs integrity. Unselected it‚Äôs allowed to devolve down to brutish polygon. Custom parameters can be set to filter on the instance export rather than editing the font directly. In this way you can also have different settings for different sets of glyphs. This can be useful when dealing with relatively small paths such as diacritics or punctuation. Sample: `Angularize; segsize:120; detail:True;`

packages.name: Show Zero-Width Glyphs.glyphsReporter
packages.title: Show Zero-Width Glyphs
packages.description: *View* ‚Üí *Show Zero-Width Glyphs* draws colored lines to indicate the presence of zero-width glyphs.

packages.name: Keyboard Selection Travel.glyphsPlugin
packages.title: Keyboard Selection Travel
packages.description: Hold down the Control key to move the selection with the arrow keys.

packages.name: Guten Tag.glyphsPalette
packages.title: Guten Tag
packages.description: Tag your glyphs and quickly navigate between related glyphs. Read the [Guten Tag handbook](https://florianpircher.com/glyphs/plugins/guten-tag/Handbook.pdf) for details.

packages.name: Close Window.glyphsPlugin
packages.title: Close Window
packages.description: Adds a *Close Window* command to the *File* menu which closes the current font window.

packages.name: SaveToGit.glyphsPlugin
packages.title: Save to Git
packages.description: *File > Save to Git* saves your font and commits the changes to a git repository. Well suited if you just want to keep track of your changes.

packages.name: StepAndRepeat.glyphsPalette
packages.title: Step and Repeat
packages.description: The palette *Step and Repeat* (de: *Wiederholen*, fr: *R√©p√©ter*, es: *Repetir*, pt: *Repetir*) allows shift-repeating shapes. Repeated shapes will be added to the selection for further transformations. At least one of the *X* and *Y* shifts must be non-zero. The *Steps* count includes the original, so it must be at least¬†2.

packages.name: ShowAnchorCloud.glyphsReporter
packages.title: Show Anchor Cloud
packages.description: *View > Show Anchor Cloud* displays a mark cloud for all glyphs which use the selected anchor, regardless of name. It also allows the user to filter which mark glyphs are displayed in the cloud.

packages.name: ShowDistanceAndAngleOfNodesInCorner.glyphsReporter
packages.title: Show Distance And Angle in Corner
packages.description: *View > Show Distance and Angle in Corner* shows the direct distance of two selected elements (Nodes, Anchors, Components) and their angle. The times of temporarily created guidelines are pass√©.

packages.name: Fade.glyphsFilter
packages.title: Fade
packages.description: *Filter > Fade* (de: *Verschwinden,* fr: *Dispara√Ætre,* es: *Desaparecer,* pt: *Desaparecer,* jp: *Ê∂à„Åà„Çã,* ko: *ÏÇ¨ÎùºÏßÄÎã§,* zh: *Ê∂àÂ§±*) removes parts of glyphs beneath or beyond a certain coordinate. As value use `x<200`or `y>300`, or multiple conditions in a comma-separated list `x>500, y<200`.

packages.name: Risorizer.glyphsFilter
packages.title: Risorizer
packages.description: Effect plug-in for adding a Risograph-like effect on your shapes.

packages.name: ItalicExtremes.glyphsFilter
packages.title: Italic Extremes
packages.description: *Filter > Italic Extreme* adds points on a specified angle. The default angle is the italic angle from the selected master when launching the plugin. Multiple angles can be entered separated by commas, and will be processed successively. The checkboxes allow to optionally delete V/H extremes or slanted curve nodes that match the specified angles, effectively switching an outline between V/H and Italic extremes. Keep in mind that not all curves can be replicated exactly with a different point placement. Glyphs‚Äô algorithm to keep a shape when removing nodes works well, but is not magic.

packages.name: MagicRemove.glyphsPalette
packages.title: Magic Remover
packages.description: Magic Remover (de: *Magic-L√∂scher,* es: *Borrador magico,* fr: *Gomme magique,* pt: *Apagador m√°gico*) is a button in the right-hand side palette that enables multiple-master deletion of selected nodes, anchors, components and corner components. Deleting (any number of) nodes will try to keep the shape, similar to what happens when you individually delete nodes.

packages.name: Scrambler.glyphsPalette
packages.title: Scrambler
packages.description: *Scrambler* is a palette extension that creates a new tab with a generated random sequence of selected glyphs. Useful at the initial design stages or to have a feel of the rhythm of the typeface. Works with numbers and non-Latin characters.

packages.name: NodesCloseToZones.glyphsReporter
packages.title: Show Nodes Close To Zones
packages.description:
*View > Show Nodes Close To Zones* (de: *Punkte knapp neben Zonen anzeigen,* fr: *Afficher n≈ìuds proches des zones,* es: *Mostrar nodos cerca de zonas,* pt: *Exibir n√≥s perto de zonas*) highlights nodes which are close to an alignment zone but are neither in nor on the boundary of an alignment zone (sensitivity is ‚â§ 4 units distance).
*Right Click > New Tab: Nodes Close to Zone* opens a new tab listing all glyphs with potentially misaligned nodes.
Written by Olli Meier

packages.name: GlobalGlyph.glyphsReporter
packages.title: Global Glyph
packages.description: *View > Show Global Glyph* displays the glyph named `_global` in the background of other glyphs. This can give an alternative to global guidelines. See GitHub for some craft tips

packages.name: GaugeTool.glyphsTool
packages.title: Gauge Tool
packages.description: The tool shows an oval for a mouse cursor which can be used to gauge the width of strokes.

packages.name: Shadow.glyphsFilter
packages.title: Shadow
packages.description: *Filter > Shadow* (de: *Schatten*, fr: *Ombreur*, nl: *Schaduw*, es: *Sombrear*, zh: üåñÈò¥ÂΩ±) turns your glyphs into shadowed versions of themselves.

packages.name: ShowItalic.glyphsReporter
packages.title: Show Italic
packages.description: *View > Show Italic* (de: *Kursive*, es: *it√°licas*, fr: *italique*, zh: ü•ÇÊÑèÂ§ßÂà©‰Ωì) displays the italic counterpart of the current upright glyph in Edit view (and vice versa), given that both the Upright and Italic fonts are opened in Glyphs, and given that the other font contains a glyph with the same name. It is useful for stepping through the glyphs and checking if there is an undesired deviation, e.‚Äâg., a different diacritic height or different descender depth.

packages.name: Variable Font Preview X.glyphsReporter
packages.title: Variable Font Preview 3
packages.description:
Variable Font Preview now available for Glyphs 3. This is a fully functional 30 days trial. What are you waiting for?
Contact me for Student Discounts.

packages.name: SmartPlumblines.glyphsReporter
packages.title: Show Smart Plumblines
packages.description:
*View > Show Smart Plumblines* (de: *Intelligente Lotschnur anzeigen,* fr: *Afficher lignes intelligentes de construction,* es: *Mostrar l√≠neas inteligentes de construcci√≥n*) displays **live guidelines** at the center of each paths‚Äô (red) and components‚Äô (grey) bounding box.
If you select anything, it also displays the center of that selection (blue dashed).
One major feature is that the guidelines **automatically match your italic angle**.
This is useful for aligning objects by sight. As well as:

- Align multiple paths and/or components
- Setting up horizontal positions of anchors
- Editing segments while easily keeping italic angle, etc.

packages.name: ShowDistanceAndAngleOfNodes.glyphsReporter
packages.title: Show Distance & Angle
packages.description: *View > Show Distance & Angle* (de: *Abstand & Winkel anzeigen,* fr: *Afficher distance & angle,* es: *Mostrar distancia & angulo*) shows the distance and angle of 2 selected elements. Those can be nodes, but also components or anchors and they don‚Äôt have to be of the same kind.

packages.name: RedArrow.glyphsReporter
packages.title: Red Arrow
packages.description:
*View > Red Arrows:* Now Glyphs users can also have red arrows!
This reporter points out possible outline errors. This version works in Glyphs 2.3 and newer. When the plugin is active, red arrows will point to possible mistakes in your outlines.

packages.name: DrawBot.glyphsPlugin
packages.title: DrawBot
packages.description:
DrawBot inside Glyphs.
Make a new drawBot from *File > New DrawBot,* or open a `.py` file with Cmd-O. *File > Save* as usual. Run the script by hitting the Run button (or pressing Cmd-‚èé). Clean the output area by pressing Cmd-K.

To save a drawing as pdf, hit Cmd-E (*File > Export‚Ä¶*)

packages.name: ShowTopsAndBottoms.glyphsReporter
packages.title: Show Tops and Bottoms
packages.description: *View > Show Tops And Bottoms* (es: *superiores e inferiores*, de: *H√∂chste und tiefste Stellen*, nl: *hoogste en laagste plekken*, fr: *les hauts et les bas*, zh: üößÂ∫ïÈÉ®Âà∞È°∂ÁÇπÁöÑÊï∞ÂÄº) displays the bounding box tops and bottoms for each glyph in the Edit view, and marks them red if they are not inside an alignment zone. Also highlights nodes *inside* zones if they are missing a metric line by 1 unit.

packages.name: OffsetPreview.glyphsReporter
packages.title: Offset Preview
packages.description: *View > Show Offset Curve Parameter Preview* calculates the *GlyphsFilterOffsetCurve* parameters in active instances for the given glyph and draws those instances behind your paths. It quietly adds extremum and inflection nodes to your preview outlines. But it does not give you a full preview of the final instance, because it does not show the effect of any other parameters. It is focused on helping you spot path offset problems.

packages.name: ShowStyles.glyphsReporter
packages.title: Show Styles
packages.description: *View > Show Styles* (de: *Stile anzeigen,* es: *Mostrar estilos,* fr: *Afficher styles,* pt: *Exibir estilos,* zh: üíóÊèíÂÄº) calculates all active styles for the given glyph and draws them behind your paths. Will highlight the currently selected style (i.e., selected in the Preview area at the bottom). Right-click for extra options (centering shape, aligning on a node). Use `ShowStyles` parameter in *Font Info > Font* or *Styles* for defining colors: as value, use comma-separated numbers for RGBA, between 0.0 and 1.0, e.‚Äâg., `0, 1, 0.2` for green with a small hint of blue in it. Run `Glyphs.defaults['com.mekkablue.ShowStyles.anchors']=True` in Macro Window to also show interpolation of anchors.

packages.name: ShowFilledPreview.glyphsReporter
packages.title: Show Filled Preview while Editing
packages.description: *View > Show Filled Preview* (de: *Gef√ºllte Vorschau beim Bearbeiten,* es: *contornos rellenos durante la edici√≥n,* fr: *aper√ßu des formes pendant la √©dition*) fills open paths with a dark gray color even while you are still drawing. For controlling the opacity, run `Glyphs.defaults['com.mekkablue.ShowFilledPreview.opacity']=0.6` in *Window > Macro Panel.* Any value between 0.0 and 1.0 is possible.

packages.name: ShowExportStatus.glyphsReporter
packages.title: Show Export Status
packages.description: *View Show Export Status* (de: *Export-Status anzeigen,* es: *Mostrar estado del exporto,* fr: *Afficher stade d‚Äôexport*) displays a red cross over non-exporting glyphs in Edit View.

packages.name: ShowDistanceBetweenTwoPoints.glyphsReporter
packages.title: Show Distance Between two Points
packages.description: *View > Show Distance Between Two Points* (es: *Mostrar distancia entre dos puntos,* de: *Abstand zwischen zwei Punkten anzeigen,* fr: *Afficher distance entre deux points,* pt: *Exibir dist√¢ncia entre dois pontos*) displays the distance between two selected nodes when exactly two points are selected, ignoring intersections in between.

packages.name: ShowCoordinatesOfSelectedNodes.glyphsReporter
packages.title: Show Coordinates of Selected Nodes
packages.description:
*View > Show Coordinates of Selected Nodes* (de: *Koordinaten ausgew√§hlter Punkte anzeigen,* fr: *Afficher les coordonn√©es des n≈ìuds s√©lectionn√©s,* es: *Mostrar las coordenadas de nodos seleccionados,* pt: *Exibir coordenadas dos n√≥s selecionados*) displays coordinates for selected on-curve nodes, as well as length and angle of the surrounding handles and line segments. 
Run this line in the Macro Window to disable display of (on-curve) node info:
`Glyphs.defaults['com.mekkablue.ShowCoordinatesOfSelectedNodes.showNodes'] = False`
Run this line in the Macro Window to disable display of (off-curve) handle info:
`Glyphs.defaults['com.mekkablue.ShowCoordinatesOfSelectedNodes.showHandles'] = False`
To reset the prefs, run any or both of these lines in Macro Window:
`del Glyphs.defaults['com.mekkablue.ShowCoordinatesOfSelectedNodes.showNodes']`
`del Glyphs.defaults['com.mekkablue.ShowCoordinatesOfSelectedNodes.showHandles']`

packages.name: ShowComponentOrder.glyphsReporter
packages.title: Show Component Order
packages.description: *View > Show Component Order* (de: *Reihenfolge der Komponenten anzeigen,* fr: *Afficher ordre des composants,* es: *Mostrar orden de componentes*) displays components in different colors depending on the order of the component. This way, you can step through your component-based glyphs (fn-arrows or Home/End on large keyboards), or open them all in a tab, and quickly spot an order mistake.

packages.name: ShowAngledHandles.glyphsReporter
packages.title: Show Angled Handles
packages.description: *View > Show Angled Handles* (de: *Schr√§ge Anfasser anzeigen*, es: *Mostrar manejadores inclinados*, fr: *Afficher les poign√©es inclin√©es*, it: *Mostra maniglie inclinate*, zh: ‚öñÔ∏èË∑ØÂæÑÊ£ÄÊü•Â∑•ÂÖ∑) highlights BCPs (‚Äòhandles‚Äô) which are not horizontal or vertical, quite-but-not-completely-straight line segments, duplicate path segments, crossed handles, nodes missing metrics, and zero handles. Options in the context menu.

packages.name: Retractor.glyphsFilter
packages.title: Retractor
packages.description: *Filter > Retractor* (de: *Retraktor,* fr: *Retracteur,* es: *Retractor,* zh: üìêÁõ¥Á∫øÂåñ) deletes (‚Äòretracts‚Äô) all B√©zier control points (a.‚Äâk.‚Äâa. BCPs, handles), making sure only straight line segments remain. This can be useful if you want to be certain that accidentally added curve segments are removed in designs where this is necessary, or when you want to simplify a vectorisation with many small curve segments.

packages.name: FixZeroHandles.glyphsFilter
packages.title: Fix Zero Handles
packages.description: *Filter > Fix Zero Handles* (de: *Null-Anfasser beheben,* fr: *Corriger les poign√©es r√©tract√©es,* es: *Corregir manejadores cero,* zh: üç≠‰øÆÊ≠£ÂçïÊëáËáÇ) analyses the path structure of selected layers and will rearrange path segments that contain completely retracted handles, a.‚Äâk.‚Äâa. ‚Äòzero handles‚Äô. Zero handles typically appear in outlines imported from other vector apps, such as Adobe Illustrator. Zero handles are considered bad style, or even an error, and can cause a range of problems, especially when you are trying to convert your outlines to TrueType curves.

packages.name: Disguiser.glyphsFilter
packages.description: *Filter > Disguiser* replaces the layer with a rectangle covering its bounds. This is useful for sharing files that contain sensitive designs. If invoked on a partial selection, the Disguiser will place a rectangle only over the selected parts.

packages.name: CutAndShake.glyphsFilter
packages.title: Cut and Shake
packages.description: *Filter > Cut and Shake* (de: *Schneiden und sch√ºtteln,* fr: *Couper et secouer,* es: *Cortar y agitar,* zh: ü§∫Á¢éÁâáÂåñ) exercises cuts across selected glyphs, and then both moves and rotates the resulting parts by random amounts, for which the user can specify maximums.

packages.name: BroadNibber.glyphsFilter
packages.title: BroadNibber
packages.description: *Filter > BroadNibber* (fr: *Traceur,* de: *Mit Breitfeder nachziehen,* es: *Trazar con pluma chata,* zh: *‚úíÔ∏èÊâÅÂ§¥Á¨îÈ£éÊ†ºÂåñ*) turns monolines of all selected glyphs into broad-nib strokes.

packages.name: InsertInflections.glyphsFilter
packages.title: Insert Inflections
packages.description: *Filter > Insert Inflections* (de: *Inflektionspunkte einf√ºgen,* fr: *Ajouter les points d‚Äôinflexion,* es: *Agregar puntos de inflexi√≥n,* zh: üé¢Êõ≤Á∫øÊãêÁÇπ) inserts nodes on all inflections of all selected glyphs. This is useful for monoline workflows, where inflected paths need to be expanded to a closed stroke; and for conversion into TrueType outlines.

packages.name: Inverter.glyphsFilter
packages.title: Inverter
packages.description: *Filter > Inverter* (en: *Inverter,* de: *Umkehren,* fr: *Inverter,* es: *Invertar,* it: *Invertire,* pt: *Inverter*) provides a GUI for inverting glyphs. It puts an enclosing rectangle around your glyphs, slanted to the italic angle. You can set the top and bottom edge, as well as its overlap beyond its sidebearings.

packages.name: LayerGeek.glyphsFilter
packages.title: Layer Geek
packages.description: *Filter > Layer Geek* provides a GUI for batch-executing Python and PyObjC methods on selected layers. For an overview of what you can do, click on the GitHub link:

packages.name: Noodler.glyphsFilter
packages.title: Noodler
packages.description: *Filter > Noodler* (de: *Nudler*, fr: *Nouilleur*, es: *Fileteador*, zh: üçúÁ≠âÁ∫øÂúÜ‰Ωì) turns monolines of all selected glyphs into noodles with rounded stroke endings.

packages.name: ShowNodeCount.glyphsReporter
packages.title: Show Node Count
packages.description: *View > Show Node Count* Does what the name says üòÖ.

packages.name: ShowRotated.glyphsReporter
packages.title: Show Rotated
packages.description: *View > Show Rotated* Superimposes the current glyph as a rotated copy of itself. Context Menu slider to adjust the rotation angle.

packages.name: ShowSiblings.glyphsReporter
packages.title: Show Siblings (Light)
packages.description: *View > Show Siblings* Superimposes a group of predefined glyphs in the background of your letters. This can be both pretty helpful in the beginning of a design as well as at intermediate progress where quick proof overview is needed. The degree of a desired match depends on each design, of course. Current Scripts: Latin, Greek, Cyrillic and ¬ªTwins¬´ (glyph alternates like *g.ss01* or *g.alt.*

packages.name: SyncTabs.glyphsPlugin
packages.title: Sync Tabs
packages.description: *View > Sync Tabs* (de: *Tabs synchron halten,* fr: *Synchroniser les onglets,* es: *Sincronizar pesta√±as*) keeps the current tabs of all open fonts in sync with the currently active tab. In **realtime!**

packages.name: BlindFold.glyphsReporter
packages.title: Show Blindfold
packages.description: *View > Show Blindfold* (de: *Blenden anzeigen,* fr: *Afficher bandeaux,* es: *Mostrar vendas*) blackens out everything beyond the xHeight (or Cap-Height --> option in context menu). Useful for Spacing and Kerning because the visible leftover is what matters the most here.

packages.name: BlindFold Neue.glyphsReporter
packages.title: BlindFold Neue
packages.description: *BlindFold Neue* (zh: ÁúºÁΩ© Neue) is a forked version of Blindfold. It covers the boundary of the glyphs. Useful for CJK font design.

packages.name: CJK Metrics.glyphsReporter
packages.title: CJK Metrics
packages.description: *CJK Metrics* (zh: Ê±âÂ≠óÂ∫¶Èáè) shows mertics used in CJK font design, including medial axes (Ê∞¥Âπ≥ÂûÇÁõ¥ËΩ¥Á∫ø), central area (Á¨¨‰∫å‰∏≠ÂøÉÂå∫Âüü), CJK guide (Ê±âÂ≠óÂèÇËÄÉÁ∫ø), etc.

packages.name: ArrangeWindows.glyphsPlugin
packages.title: Arrange Windows
packages.description:
*Window > Arrange Windows* does just what it says.
**Options:**
*Arrange Windows & Macro Panel* [Option Key].
*Arrange Windows On Screens* [Shift Key] if 2 Fonts and 2 Screens are present.

packages.name: LabelColor.glyphsReporter
packages.title: Show Label Color
packages.description: *View > Show Label Color* (de: *Etikettenfarbe anzeigen,* fr: *Afficher couleur d‚Äôetiquette,* es: *Mostrar color de etiqueta*) displays each glyphs‚Äôs Label Color in the edit tab. Full width or left: glyph color, right: layer color.

packages.name: ReporterToggler.glyphsPalette
packages.title: Reporter Toggler
packages.description: Adds a menu to the Palette, which gives you instant access to all your reporter plugins. Quick‚Äôn‚Äôeasy on/off switching with just a single click.

packages.name: ShowKerningGroups.glyphsReporter
packages.title: Show Kerning Groups
packages.description: *View > Show Kerning Groups* displays all members of the currently active glyph‚Äôs kerning group to either side in miniature and realtime. Useful when setting up kerning groups and getting visual feedback right away. If you see elements sticking out of the right group, you know there might be a group member set wrong. Same for the left side. It is somehow related to the built-in feature "Show Group Members" by Georg Seifert, but this one does not need the caret to sit between a certain pair.

packages.name: ShowNextFont.glyphsReporter
packages.title: Show Next Font
packages.description: *View > Show Next Font* shows in a light orange colour the same glyph of another opened font. It could be useful for visual comparison of italics with normal styles,or different versions of the same font.

packages.name: ShowAnchorsCompatibility.glyphsReporter
packages.title: Show Anchors Compatibility
packages.description: *View > Show Anchors Compatibility* is a complementary tool for Show Masters compatibility for those cases where the masters are not compatible because the absence of wrong naming of an anchor. The plugin displays a red circle behind the anchor that is not present in all masters.

packages.name: ShowNextFontAnchors.glyphsReporter
packages.title: Show Next Font Anchors
packages.description:
*View > Show Next Font Anchors* shows in a light orange colour the list of anchors used in the glyph of the next font and in gray colour the list of current font anchors.
If anchors names and quantity matches between fonts it display the word "OK" in green. Useful to compare versions of fonts or regular vs italics.

packages.name: showCoordinates.glyphsReporter
packages.title: Show Coordinates
packages.description: *View > Show Coordinates* is similar to the Measurement tool, but it constantly displays the node coordinates and the handles' delta values.

packages.name: Kernkraft.glyphsPlugin
packages.title: Kernkraft
packages.description:
*Glyph > Kernkraft* and *Glyph > Kernschmelze* by Mark Fr√∂mberg (Mark2Mark). Kenrkraft simplifies the process of accessing all the glyph pairs provided by your font, regardless of the size of the character set. Easily navigate through the glyphs with the keyboard arrows (‚Üê, ‚Üí) and Enter key (‚èé), while the tool automatically marks the completed glyphs in a convenient TODO list.

Kernschmelze interpolates the kerning of two masters.

packages.name: ShowStems.glyphsReporter
packages.title: Show Stems (Light)
packages.description:
*View > Show Stems* (de: *St√§mme anzeigen,* fr: *Afficher les traits,* es: *Mostrar astas*) shows a measurement line (even in edit mode) with all distances between the outlines. If any distance matches the saved metrics in the Glyphs Palette, it will highlight in green and tell you which one it matches. The vertical position is attached to the Glyphsapp measurement line and can be moved around the same way.
Shortcut: Cmd-Opt-Ctrl-S (like **S**tems)

packages.name: Erode.glyphsFilter
packages.title: Erode
packages.description: *Filter > Erode* simulates wear and tear on your glyphs by rubbing away random bits of the outlines, especially around corners.

packages.name: Unitizer.glyphsReporter
packages.title: Unitizer
packages.description: *View > Show Unitizer* displays unit guidelines in the background (corresponding to a value that you can configure at will) of the current glyph in Edit view. This is helpful for working in unitized fonts.

packages.name: ShowNodeIndexes.glyphsReporter
packages.title: Show Node Indexes
packages.description: *View > Show Node Indexes* (fr: *Afficher num√©ros des n≈ìuds,* es: *listado de nodos,* de: *Indexnummern*) shows index numbers for the current glyph in Edit view. Toggle display of BCP indexes via context menu.

packages.name: DeleteSmallPaths.glyphsFilter
packages.title: Delete Small Paths
packages.description: *Filter > Delete Small Paths* (es: *Borrar trazados peque√±os*, de: *Kleine Pfade l√∂schen*, fr: *Supprimer les petits trac√©s*) deletes all paths smaller than a threshold value in square units. It can be useful for cleaning up glyphs from vector debris.

packages.name: RekhaViewer.glyphsReporter
packages.title: Rekha Viewer
packages.description: *View > Show Rekha* shows a Rekha line in Bengali, Devanagari and Gurmukhi letters. It takes its values from a custom parameter in *File > Font Info > Masters* called *Rekha*, with comma-separated values for height, thickness and overshoot. If a *rekha* anchor is present in the glyph, it will use it as the left edge of the Rekha line.

packages.name: RekhaMaker.glyphsFilter
packages.title: Rekha Maker
packages.description: *Filter > RekhaMaker* inserts a Rekha line in Bengali, Devanagari and Gurmukhi letters. Supply values for height, thickness and overshoot, and press the *Insert* button. If a *rekha* anchor is present in the glyph, it will use it as the left edge of the Rekha line.

packages.name: RemoveKerningExceptions.glyphsFilter
packages.title: Remove Kerning Exceptions
packages.description: *Filter > Remove Kerning Exceptions* (de: *Kerning-Ausnahmen entfernen,* fr: *Supprimer les exceptions de cr√©nage,* es: *Borrar excepciones de kerning*) removes all kerning exception of selected glyphs in the current master, leaving group kerning intact. Its true power lies in its application as custom parameter. This can be useful in situations where you change the shape of a letter with a *Rename Glyphs* parameter, and its kerning exceptions do not apply anymore.

packages.name: Heatmap.glyphsReporter
packages.title: Heatmap
packages.description: *View > Show Heatmap* visualizes the thickness of glyph stems, helping you to create even and consistent curves.

packages.name: StemThickness.glyphsReporter
packages.title: Show Stem Thickness
packages.description: *View > Stem Thickness* (de: *Stammst√§rke anzeigen,* fr: *Afficher l‚Äô√©paisseur de traits,* es: *Mostrar espesor,* jp: *„Çπ„ÉÜ„É†„ÅÆÂ§™„Åï*) shows how thick the stem is at the current mouse position.

packages.name: GlyphNote.glyphsPalette
packages.title: Glyph Note
packages.description: Adds Glyph Note (de: *Glyphennotiz,* es: *Nota de glifo,* fr: *Notes du glyphe*) to your Palette (Cmd-Opt-P), displaying the notes for the currently selected glyph(s).

packages.name: MakeCorner.glyphsFilter
packages.title: Make Corner

packages.name: ShowCrosshair.glyphsReporter

packages.name: Speedlines.glyphsFilter

packages.name: Waterfall.glyphsPlugin

packages.name: ShowMarkPreview.glyphsReporter

packages.name: Skedge.glyphsPlugin

packages.name: Backuper.glyphsPlugin

packages.name: word-o-mat.glyphsPlugin
packages.title: Word-o-Mat

packages.name: Touche.glyphsPlugin

packages.name: SegmentLength.glyphsReporter

packages.name: Beowulferize.glyphsFilter

packages.name: Wordfinder.glyphsPlugin
packages.title: Wordfinder

packages.name: ChangeIncrement.glyphsPalette
packages.title: Change Keyboard Increment
packages.description: This plug-in helps you to change the default keyboard increment value to a settable new one.

packages.name: MakeBoxes.glyphsFilter

packages.name: ShowGlyphFocus.glyphsReporter

packages.name: ShowComponentsCompatibility.glyphsReporter

packages.name: AnchorsPalette/Anchors.glyphsPalette
packages.title: Anchors Palette
packages.description: The palette shows the position of anchors in the selected glyphs. This helps you check for consistent positioning of anchors: just select multiple glyphs. For example, select A‚ÄìZ to see whether all top anchors are on the same height. Note that the fields are editable, so you can adjust the anchors‚Äô x or y of multiple glyphs at once.

packages.name: CapsAndCorners/CapsAndCorners.glyphsPlugin
packages.title: Caps and Corners
packages.description: This window shows the cap and corner components in the selected glyphs. This helps you check for consistency: just select multiple glyphs. Note that the fields are editable, so you can adjust the scaling of caps and corners for multiple glyphs at once.

packages.name: AlignmentPalette/Alignment.glyphsPalette
packages.title: Alignment Palette
packages.description:
This palette shows the position of the center of the glyph bounding box. This works with components, with multiple glyphs selected and is also editable. Useful for centering all case-sensitive punctuation vertically, or to check whether mathematical operands are on the same x position (use Glyphs‚Äô built-in glyph info to check whether they have the same advance width). Note that the bounding box center may be .5 even if your font has a grid of 1 without subdivisions (i.‚Äâe. integer coordinates). The node/path selection is intentionally ignored.

The Overshoots section displays the overshoot of the selected glyph(s) relative to each alignment zone.

packages.name: SuffixesPalette/Suffixes.glyphsPalette
packages.title: Suffixes Palette
packages.description: This palette shows the name(s) of the selected glyph(s), split by suffix. The fields are editable. This is useful for quickly changing the suffix of multiple glyphs at once.

packages.name: GlyphSILE.glyphsPlugin
packages.title: GlyphSILE

packages.name: ShowHintsAlsoInOtherMasters.glyphsReporter

packages.name: SetPalette.glyphsPalette
packages.title: Set Palette

packages.name: LayerWhale.glyphsPalette
packages.title: Layer Whale

A design workflow tool.

- Design using *checkpoints*
- Help declutter your Layers palette!
- Playback & export time-lapse animations of glyphs.

packages.name: KernIndicator.glyphsReporter
packages.title: Show Kerning Values
packages.description:
*View > Show Kerning Values* (de: *Kerning-Werte anzeigen,* es: *Mostrar valores de Kerning,* fr: *Afficher valeurs de cr√©nage*) shows the kerning values just below the ascender height in Edit view.
Customize the offset in relation to the ascender (default -50) by running this line in Macro Window: `Glyphs.defaults['com.mekkablue.KernIndicator.offset'] = 100` (instead of 100, type your intended value, of course).

packages.name: SnapKiller.glyphsPlugin

packages.name: DeCasteljauBezier.glyphsPlugin

packages.name: ShowCharacter.glyphsReporter
packages.title: Show Character

packages.name: MasterSelector.glyphsPlugin

packages.name: Scrawl.glyphsTool

packages.name: FillBackgroundPath.glyphsReporter

packages.name: SuperTool.glyphsTool

packages.name: OptimizeStartNodes.glyphsFilter
packages.title: Optimize Start Node Placement
packages.description: *Filter > Optimize Start Nodes* (de: *Startpunkte optimieren,* es: *Optimizar los primeros nodos,* fr: *Optimiser les n≈ìuds pr√©miers*) will optimize the placement of start nodes so that they immediately follow after a straight line segment if possible.

packages.name: Stitcher.glyphsFilter
packages.title: Stitcher
packages.description: *Filter > Stitcher* will distribute components along an (open) path at a certain interval. Components will be placed according to the origin point (0,0) or, if available, an *origin* anchor in the original glyph. Adding an *orientation* anchor will make the component orient itself onto the path. The *Balance Components* option stretches the distribution along the *complete* path, so that components are placed on the first and last point of the (open) path. You can add multiple components if you separate them with commas. Adding an asterisk to a component name will mask the respective component. Hint: If used as custom parameter, use as *PreFilter* rather than *Filter.*

packages.name: Inliner.glyphsFilter
packages.title: Inliner
packages.description: *Filter > Inliner* will expand a skeleton path to an inlined stroke. *Stroke Width* is the complete width of the (double) stroke. *Inline Width* is the width of the white gap inside the stroke.

packages.name: ShowOnlySelectedHandles.glyphsReporter

packages.name: MasterSwitcher.glyphsPalette

packages.name: System7Shadow.glyphsFilter

packages.name: GlyphGiffer.glyphsPlugin
packages.title: GlyphGiffer
packages.description: GlyphGiffer lets you export glyphs from a folder of .ufo/.glyphs files as an animated GIF. Input either slash-escaped glyph names (e.‚Äâg. `/Aacute/Ampersand/Eth`) or a string of A-Z and a-z chars (e.‚Äâg. `ABCDEFG`). It currently doesn‚Äôt seem support composite glyphs. **Requires Drawbot.**

packages.name: SimplePreview.glyphsPlugin
packages.title: SimplePreview
packages.description:
*SimplePreview* lets you preview texts which is in editing window. You can control the text size and directions in this preview plugin.

**If it isn't installed on your device, you can install the paid script version at *LineGap's Script* on the *Scripts* tab. (The script version has more functionalities.)**

packages.name: Backdrop.glyphsReporter

packages.name: SF Symbol Template.glyphsFileFormat

packages.name: AutoCADShapeExporter.glyphsFileFormat

This is a fully functional 30 days trial. What are you waiting for?

packages.name: GreenHarmony.glyphsFilter

packages.description: *Filter > Green Harmony* (de: *Gr√ºne Harmonie,* fr: *Harmonie verte,* es: *Armon√≠a verde,* cs: *Zelen√° harmonie,* pt: *Harmonia verde,* jp: Á∑ë„ÅÆË™øÂíå, ko: ÎÖπÏÉâ Ï°∞Ìôî, zh: ÁªøËâ≤ÂíåË∞ê) moves selected green on-curve nodes to their G2 position, creating a harmonized transition from one curve segment to the next. Or *all* green nodes if none are selected. Hold down Opt to harmonize on all masters.

packages.name: GreyHarmony.glyphsFilter
packages.title: Grey Harmony
packages.description: Grey Harmony (*de:* Graue Harmonie, *fr:* Harmonie grise, *es:* Armon√≠a gris, *cs:* ≈†ed√° harmonie, *pt:* Harmonia cinzenta, *ru:* –°–µ—Ä–∞—è –≥–∞—Ä–º–æ–Ω–∏—è, *jp:* ÁÅ∞Ëâ≤„ÅÆË™øÂíå, *ko:* ÌöåÏÉâ Ï°∞Ìôî, *zh:* ü¶õÁÅ∞Ëâ≤ÂíåË∞ê) is a Glyphs.app filter that G2-harmonizes selected ‚Äúsmooth‚Äù connections by moving the surrounding BCPs rather than the green on-curve node itself (which is what [Green Harmony](glyphsapp3://showplugin/Green%20Harmony) does).

packages.name: Text View Width.glyphsPalette
packages.title: Text View Width
packages.description: The Text View Width palette allows to set the view width relative to the width of a given glyph. This means that the line breaks will appear about the same for all masters. The plug-in dynamically updates the width when you switch between masters. It uses the following input format: `20 H` or `15 space` etc., which means 20 times the width of the glyph `H` or 15 times the width of the `space` glyph. You can also set the width in units (the same way as in *Glyphs > Preferences > Appearance*). To turn the plug-in off, leave the input empty.

packages.name: LT-Global-Background.glyphsReporter
packages.title: Leedotype Global Background
packages.description: *View > Show LT Global Background* displays the outline of a selected glyph in the background, similar to the *Global Mask* functionality in Fontlab V.

packages.name: Distribute.glyphsPalette
packages.title: Distribute
packages.description: *Distribute* (de: *Verteilen,* fr: *R√©partir,* es: *Distribuir,* pt: *Distribuir,* cs: *Rozlo≈æit,* zh: ÈáçÊñ∞ÊéíÂàó) is a palette for distributing shapes.

packages.name: CleanUpLines.glyphsFilter
packages.title: Clean Up Lines
packages.description: *Filter > Clean Up Lines* (de: *Linien aufr√§umen,* fr: *Nettoyer les lignes,* es: *Limpiar l√≠neas,* pt: *Limpar linhas retas,* jp: „É©„Ç§„É≥„Çí„ÇØ„É™„Éº„É≥„Ç¢„ÉÉ„Éó, ko: ÎùºÏù∏ Ï†ïÎ¶¨, zh: Ê∏ÖÁêÜÁ∫øË∑Ø) will remove all (blue) on-curve points between two line segments if the two segments form an angle smaller than the given threshold.

packages.name: MATHPlugin.glyphsPlugin
packages.title: OpenType MATH Plug-in
packages.description:
A plug-in for editing and exporting OpenType MATH table. _Edit ‚Üí Edit MATH Constants..._ for editing font-level MATH table constants, _Glyph ‚Üí Edit MATH Variants..._ for editing glyph-level MATH variants,
 assembly, and extended shape flag, and _View ‚Üí Show MATH Italic Correction_, _View ‚Üí Show MATH Top Accent Position_, _View ‚Üí Show MATH Cut-ins_ for showing various MATH positioning info.

packages.name: CurveEQ.glyphsFilter
packages.title: Curve Equalizer
packages.description: *Curve Equalizer* is a filter that lets you quickly balance the B√©zier handles of a curve, or change its curvature interactively.

packages.name: KeepCounterShapes.glyphsFilter
packages.title: Keep Counter Shapes
packages.description: *Filter > Keep Counter Shapes* (de: *Punzen behalten*) deletes all outer curves and keeps only counters.

packages.name: KeepOuterShapes.glyphsFilter
packages.title: Keep Outer Shapes
packages.description: *Filter > Keep Outer Shapes* (de: *Umrisse behalten*) deletes all counter shapes and keeps only outer curves.

packages.name: ShowGuideSheets.glyphsReporter
packages.title: Guide Sheets
packages.description: Show guide sheets for the glyph you are editing. This is useful especially for CJK glyphs editing. You can create guide sheets for each script and each master. See [readme](https://github.com/ButTaiwan/ShowGuideSheets) for details.

packages.name: SmartSelectTool.glyphsTool
packages.title: Smart Select Tool
packages.description: Selecting CJK paths more easiler and faster. See [readme](https://github.com/ButTaiwan/SmartSelectTool) for details.

packages.name: ConvertCase.glyphsPalette
packages.title: Convert Case
packages.description: Palette plugin that converts case (UPPER CASE, Title Case, lower case) in the current tab. Converts only the selected text (if any) or the whole text (if nothing is selected).

packages.name: DuplicateNodes.glyphsFilter
packages.title: Duplicate Nodes
packages.description: *Filter > Duplicate Nodes* (*en:* Duplicate Nodes, *de:* Punkte verdoppeln, *fr:* Dupliquer n≈ìuds, *es:* Duplicar nodos, *pt:* Duplicar nodos) is a Glyphs.app filter for duplicating selected on-curve nodes in place. Hold down **Opt** to duplicate the same nodes in all (compatible) masters. Hold down **Shift** to add the new nodes not exactly on top, but with 1u distance (will change the following segment slightly).

packages.name: Guides.glyphsPalette
packages.title: Guides Palette
packages.description: Guides Palette can list all the *global* guides with names. Then you can assign them to certain glyphs independently. Guides will display or hide automatically. Helpful for complex design systems such as CJK characters. QUICK NOTE: Guides with same names will make the plugin unhappy (the behavior will be unpredictable), so please keep the names unique.

packages.name: RekhaBrekha.glyphsFilter
packages.title: RekhaBrekha
packages.description:
RekhaBrekha (de: *R√§ckhaBr√§ckha,* fr: *R√©khaBr√©kha*) is for you if you use regular Bengali, Devanagari or Gurmukhi letters as components in conjuncts, and the conjuncts end up having a rekha line or two too many. RekhaBrekha will decompose any component that references an active (exporting) Bengali, Devanagari or Gurmukhi letter.

RekhaBrekha is only useful as a PreFilter in your static font exports, especially in TrueType-flavored exports. To add the PreFilter, copy this line:

`{customParameters = ({name = PreFilter;value = RekhaBrekha;});}`

... and paste it in your export‚Äôs custom parameters.

packages.name: ShowHTLSPolygons.glyphsReporter
packages.title: Show HT Letterspacer Areas
packages.description: View > Show HTLS Polygons draws a visual representation of the areas HT Letterspacer uses to calculate white space into the glyphs in edit view.

packages.name: RatioReporter.glyphsReporter
packages.description: *View > Show Ratios* displays the vertical-to-horizontal ratio between selected points.

packages.name: LineUp.glyphsFilter
packages.title: Line Up Selection
packages.description: *Filter > Line Up Selection* (de: *Punkte auff√§deln,* es: *Formar l√≠nea,* pt: *Formar linha,* jp: Áõ¥Ô∏ÄÁ∑öÔ∏ÄÂåñÔ∏Ä, ko: ÏßÅÏÑ†Ìôî, zh: üìêÈÄâ‰∏≠ÁÇπÁõ¥Á∫øÂØπÈΩê ) lines up nodes, handles and anchors in your point selection between the outermost points selected.

packages.name: UnicodeInfo.glyphsPlugin
packages.title: Unicode Info
packages.description: *Window > Unicode Info:* shows a floating window with Unicode and orthography information about the currently selected glyph. It also shows which orthographies your font supports, and can add missing characters.

packages.name: RSBline.glyphsReporter
packages.title: Show RSB
packages.description: *View > Show RSB* (de: *Nachbreite anzeigen*, fr: *Afficher approche droite*, es: *Mostrar lado derecho*). displays an additional cursor at the right sidebearing (RSB) when the Text tool is active.

packages.name: Color Flow.glyphsPalette
packages.title: Color Flow
packages.description: Color Flow is a Palette Plugin to help organize and gamify your workflow by tracking progress through visual feedback. It works by assigning meaning to Layer Color Labels which are sorted into a series of customizable catogories and made directly accessable through the sidebar.

packages.name: DragToKern.glyphsTool
packages.title: Mouse Kerning and Spacing
packages.description: Mouse Kerning and Spacing is a tool to edit kerning and spacing by dragging glyphs with your mouse.

packages.name: AnchorArranger.glyphsPalette
packages.title: Anchor Arranger
packages.description: Anchor Arranger is a Glyphs font editor. plugin and it takes care of calculating the distance between the anchors and upper or the bottom node of the glyphs and it allows you to move them easily to guarantee the consistency of your font

packages.name: Snapper.glyphsPalette
packages.title: Snapper
packages.description: Palette with a switch for toggling object snapping for the current font.

packages.name: HTLSManager.glyphsPlugin
packages.title: HT Letterspacer Manager
packages.description: The HTLS Manager is the central hub for working with Huerta Tipogr√°fica‚Äôs Letterspacer. Use it to manage font rules, per-master exceptions and parameters.

packages.name: PSExport.glyphsFileFormat
packages.title: PS Export
packages.description: Adds PostScript as new option in *File > Export‚Ä¶*, will export all exporting glyphs of all exporting instances into multi-page .ps files.

packages.name: EPSExport.glyphsFileFormat
packages.title: EPS Export
packages.description: Adds EPS as new option in *File > Export‚Ä¶*, will export all exporting glyphs of all exporting instances into separate .eps files.

packages.name: WoLiBaFoNaGen.glyphsPlugin
packages.title: WoLiBaFoNaGen (WordListBasedFontNameGenerator)
packages.description: *Window > WoLiBaFoNaGen:* will bring up a dialog in which you can enter your favourite letters and font name length preferences. Any new document you start will automatically get a font family name matching your criteria. Alternatively, you can get a name suggestion via *Edit > Suggest New Font Name.* A check for existing trademarks is not included.

packages.name: ColorToner.glyphsReporter
packages.title: Color Toner (Show Darkened Colors)
packages.description: *View > Show Darkened Colors* (de: *abgedunkelte Farben*) will render your components with an extra 15% black. Useful if you use a canvas color where the components are not visible well. To change the amount of darkening, run this code in Macro Window: `Glyphs.defaults["com.mekkablue.ColorToner.darken"]=0.15` and replace the `0.15` with any number between 0.0 and 1.0.

packages.name: FEAExport.glyphsFileFormat
packages.title: FEA Export
packages.description: *File > Export > FEA Export* (de: *Features-Export*) will export the font‚Äôs OpenType features in FeaKit format, into a `.fea` file.

packages.name: Context Manager.glyphsPlugin
packages.title: Context Manager
packages.description: Build your own contextual words/strings library of and access it dynamically. Context Manager is intended to help and speed up your workflow when you are looking for a word/string to proof a specific glyph. It allow user to manage contextual words/strings for each glyph and to create contextual group.

packages.name: Anchor Annotations.glyphsReporter
packages.title: Anchor Annotations
packages.description: Show anchor names for unselected anchors and anchors in inactive layers, assign colors to certain anchors, shorten the displayed anchor names via text replacement, and more anchor display modes. Activate with *View* ‚Üí *Show Anchor Annotations*.

packages.name: DashedOutline.glyphsFilter
packages.title: Dashed Outline
packages.description: *Filter > Dashed Outline* (de: *Gestrichelte Kontur*) creates a dashed outline around your glyph.

packages.name: ShiftStartPoint.glyphsFilter
packages.title: Shift Start Point
packages.description: *Filter > Shift Start Point* (de: *Startpunkt weiterschieben*) moves the start point to the following on-curve node. If used as custom parameter, you can define the number of steps with, e.g., `ShiftStartPoint; steps: 2`.

packages.name: Nine Box View.glyphsPlugin
packages.title: Nine Box View
packages.description: This plugin displays characters in a nine-box grid while editing, allowing users to easily adjust font size to maintain consistency through comparison with reference characters. Customizable reference characters and light/dark mode display are also available. Suitable for use in creating East Asian fonts. See GitHub page for more information.

packages.name: MasterStepper.glyphsPalette
packages.title: Master Stepper
packages.description: Palette for stepping through your glyphs, while displaying all masters at once. Hold down Shift to step only through glyphs currently displayed in Font view. Hold down Opt one line for each master, followed by all composites with the glyph. Hold down Ctrl to go to step to the next glyph in the current tab content.

packages.name: Rainbow FontView.glyphsPlugin
packages.title: Rainbow FontView
packages.description: Plugin to sorting dynamically FontView based of Layer/Glyph Color Labels

packages.name: Show Angle and Distance.glyphsPlugin
packages.title: Show Angle, Distance and Italic Width
packages.description: Plugin that shows the Angle, Distance and Italic Width of the selection. Click the panel to switch between Distance and Italic WIdth in italic layers.

packages.name: SelectionShelf.glyphsPalette
packages.title: Selection Shelf
packages.description: Save a selection to a 'shelf', give it a name, and retrieve the selection later. If you have certain nodes that you are often selecting and referring to, you can save them as a named selection by typing a name in the text field and clicking 'Save'. To retrieve the selection later, double click on its name in the list. If you have no longer any need for the selection, click on it in the list and press Delete to remove it.

packages.name: UnnestComponents.glyphsFilter
packages.title: Unnest Components
packages.description: *Filter > Unnest Components* (de: *Komponenten entpacken*) ‚Äòunpacks‚Äô, ‚Äòunnests‚Äô or ‚Äòflattens‚Äô components, i.e. it decomposes composites step by step until there is only one level of composition. Nested components are not bad per se, use it only if you know what you are doing. Unnesting only makes sense for TrueType exports (.ttf or TT-flavored .woff and .woff2). It has no effect on CFF exports (.otf or CFF-flavored .woff and .woff2) because PostScript-based fonts have no components. You can have the filter run at export time with a *Filter* custom parameter, with `UnnestComponents` in the filter value.

packages.name: HarmonicMove.glyphsTool
packages.title: Harmonic Move
packages.description: The plugin will scale the opposite handle to maintain the same curvature level when the selected handle changes. For example, the plugin can be used to change the weight of terminals. [Watch demo video](https://github.com/pkolchanov/HarmonicMove)

packages.name: COLRCPALJuggler.glyphsFilter
packages.title: COLR/CPAL Juggler
packages.description: CPAL/COLR Juggler (de: *COLR/CPAL-Jongleur,* fr: *Jongleur COLR/CPAL*) randomly rotates color layers between palette colors. For export it makes most sense to copy and paste this prefilter into an instance in *Font Info > Exports* (Cmd-I, Cmd-3): `{customParameters = ({name = PreFilter; value = COLRCPALJuggler;});}`

packages.name: HandleRelations/HandleRelations.glyphsReporter
packages.title: Show Handle Relations
packages.description:
*View > Show Handle Relations* displays the relative handle lengths for smooth connections between curves, and for nodes that connect a straight line and a curve (‚Äútangent points‚Äù).

This helps you avoid kinks in interpolations by keeping the relative handle lengths consistent across all masters.

packages.name: WernerHerzog.glyphsPlugin
packages.title: Werner Herzog Quotes
packages.description: Display inspirational quotes by Werner Herzog in Glyphs. Make sure to allow Glyphs to display notifications via System Settings.

packages.name: StraightenShortCurves.glyphsFilter
packages.title: Straighten Short Curves
packages.description: *Filter > Straighten Short Curves* will straighten curve segments shorter than a certain threshold length. The handles are deleted and the curve segment is turned into a line segment. Useful for cleaning up a vectorized scan or avoiding *Remove Overlap* errors at export.

packages.name: SelectionPalette.glyphsPalette
packages.title: SelectionPalette
packages.description: Palette that provides selection commands such as *undo*, *grow*, *shrink*, and a pattern-recognizing *continue*, as well as selection operations to *add*, *remove*, or *select only* elements of a certain type.

packages.name: Grader.glyphsFilter
packages.title: Grader
packages.description: Turn instances into grades, sharing the same advance widths and kerning.

packages.name: ExportUfoPlus.glyphsFileFormat
packages.title: ExportUFO-Plus
packages.description: UFO export plug-in for Glyphs.app.

packages.name: PathJuggler.glyphsPlugin
packages.title: Path Juggler
packages.description: Path Juggler plug-in for Glyphs.app.

packages.name: ShowCoordinatesDistanceAngle.glyphsReporter
packages.title: Show Coordinates Distance Angle
packages.description: Display coordinates above or below the selected nodes and handles, and display distances and angles (respected to italic) along the path lines. Shortcut assigned: ‚åòL

packages.name: Script Deck.glyphsPlugin
packages.title: Script Deck
packages.description:
Script Deck is a virtual pad controller to hold and launch your favourite scripts with simple button clicks. No more script menu digging. No more shortcut memorizing. Highly customizable: set colors and icons, name your decks, etc.

[Plugin Page](https://markfromberg.com/projects/script-deck-3)
[Manual PDF](https://markfromberg.com/user/images/glyphs/plugins/Script%20Deck%20Manual.pdf)

Try it out and see that you cannot live without it.

packages.name: FindEscapedGlyphs.glyphsPlugin
packages.title: Find Escaped Glyphs
packages.description: Glyph > Find Escaped Glyphs finds a glyph that component or path is outside the box.

packages.name: ChangeSentenceToMieum.glyphsPlugin
packages.title: Change Sentence To Mieum
packages.description: Window > 'Change Sentence To Mieum' changes the initial consonant and final consonant of the entered sentence to „ÖÅ.

packages.name: RotateView2.glyphsPlugin
packages.title: Rotate View 2
packages.description: Window for displaying a rotated view of the first line of the current tab. Based on Aaron Bell‚Äôs Rotate View for single glyphs.

packages.name: GradientHatch.glyphsFilter
packages.title: Gradient Hatch
packages.description: *Filter > Gradient Hatch* create gradient hatched outlines, built on top of the Hatch Outline filter

packages.name: ExportCSV.glyphsFileFormat
packages.title: Export CSV
packages.description: *File > Export > CSV* will export glyph info into CSV files, one file per font master.

packages.name: trueglyph.glyphsFileFormat
packages.title: True Glyph
packages.description: *Export to PDF Command + E * True Glyph is a GlyphsApp plugin that enables designers to export detailed designs, showcasing the meticulous work behind glyphs, logos, and icons. It enhances presentations, provides insights into the design process for clients, and simplifies recoloring in Illustrator for brand integration. The plugin heightens the perception of design work, connecting designer creativity with client recognition..

packages.name: Letterink.glyphsTool
packages.title: Advanced Stroke Contrast Tool ‚Äî LTTR/INK
packages.description:
**LTTR/INK** is the stroke contrast tool **inspired by Gerrit Noordzij‚Äôs The stroke: theory of writing**. Prototype rich stroke shapes of your letters with **skeletons** and use the stroke styles for **parametric** type design.

The LTTR/INK becomes an immediately familiar tool and fun to play with.

Simulate calligraphic tools: **Broad Nib**, **Pointed Pen**, **Pointed Brush**, **Flat Brush**, **Marker**

[Tutorials](https://www.lttrink.com/tutorials/lttrink-glyphs?utm_source=glppmn&utm_medium=inkap&utm_campaign=gl3&utm_content=glppmnlk&utm_term=tutorials) ‚Ä¢ [Academy](https://www.lttrink.com/academy?utm_source=glppmn&utm_medium=inkap&utm_campaign=gl3&utm_content=glppmnlk&utm_term=academy) ‚Ä¢ [Purchase](https://www.lttrink.com/pricing-glyphs?utm_source=glppmn&utm_medium=inkap&utm_campaign=gl3&utm_content=glppmnlk&utm_term=purchase)

packages.name: VariableWithKERN.glyphsFileFormat
packages.title: Export Variable Font with Automated Kern Axis
packages.description: Exports variable fonts (set up in *Font Info > Exports*) with an automated KERN axis. Gives you a slider for fading out the kerning.

packages.name: fontcExport.glyphsFileFormat
packages.title: Export with fontc
packages.description: Export Variable TTFs using [fontc](https://github.com/googlefonts/fontc), Google Fonts' font compiler written in Rust. The compiler is not production-ready yet. Please follow development progress on the Github repository at <https://github.com/googlefonts/fontc>.

packages.name: Favourites.glyphsPlugin
packages.title: Favourites
packages.description: A window for quick access to your favourite Glyphs files. The bar graph in the _Relevance_ column shows how much time you spent on each file. Drag files from Finder into the Favourites window to add them to the list, then double-click in the list to open the file.

packages.name: Emboss.glyphsFilter
packages.title: Emboss
packages.description: *Filter > Emboss* creates an embossed/beveled effect.

packages.name: Typollipse.glyphsPalette
packages.title: Typollipse
packages.description: Palette for creating base curves with minimal curvature variation.

packages.name: ProofingTool.glyphsPlugin
packages.title: Proofing Tool
packages.description: *File > Proofing Tool* generates proofs in Waterfall or Paragraph layouts, ideal for comparison across the font family‚Äôs design space. Please refer to the [Readme](https://github.com/morisawausa/ProofingTool) for template formatting instructions. *Requires Vanilla and DrawBot.*

packages.name: AllAngles.glyphsReporter
packages.title: All Angles
packages.description: *View > Show All Angles* is a reporter that displays all angles of straight lines and (optionally) handles of the currently selected glyph.

packages.name: AnchorComponents.glyphsPalette
packages.title: Anchor Components
packages.description: Select a component (typically a mark) and pick (or type the name of) an anchor in the combo box. The selected component will be reanchored to the new anchor. If you keep the combo box empty, the component will be unanchored. Click the *Propagate* button to apply the component and anchoring structure of the current master to all other masters of the active glyph.

packages.name: ShowChinesePhonetics.glyphsReporter
packages.title: Show Chinese Phonetics
packages.description: *View > Show Chinese Phonetics* displays the corresponding Chinese phonetics when editing characters. You can switch between three displaymodes via the context menu (right-click): Bopomofo, Pinyin (tone marks), and Pinyin (numbers). This is particularly helpful for Chinese characters, whose glyph names are often not intuitive.

packages.name: TextSequencer.glyphsPalette
packages.title: Text Sequencer
packages.description: A plugin that helps in generating spacing/kerning sequence strings in the glyph edit window.

packages.name: RealignHandles.glyphsFilter
packages.title: Realign Handles
packages.description: *Filter > Realign Handles* fixes interpolation kinks by realigning handles next to (green) curve nodes. Hold down Opt key for applying to all master layers at once, or use as *PreFilter* parameter with value `RealignHandles` in *Font Info > Exports* for auto-fixing kinks in static exports.

packages.name: Light Table.glyphsPlugin
packages.title: Light Table
packages.description: Light Table provides a rich set of tools and visualizations for managing your font projects. It‚Äôs built on top of Git. That means that your notes, sketch files, and Python scripts can be part of your project‚Äôs version history, too. Deeply integrated into Glyphs, Light Table‚Äôs features are always at your fingertips. And for custom needs, there is an extensive Python API. Learn more on the [Light Table website](https://formkunft.com/light-table/).

packages.name: Angularize.glyphsFilter
packages.title: Angularize
packages.description: *Filter > Angularize* subdivides curves into straight line segments.

packages.name: GroupsShelf.glyphsPlugin
packages.title: Groups Shelf
packages.description: *Window > Groups Shelf* is a kerning group manager. Visualise and manage kerning groups. Rename groups while copying kerning values. Automatically add missing composites. [Learn more](https://github.com/pkolchanov/GroupsShelf)

packages.name: HighlightImpreciseItalicAngle.glyphsReporter
packages.title: Highlight Imprecise Italic Angle
packages.description: Highlights the path segments which angle is not precise to master's Italic Angle and is within observed angle range (¬±10 degrees around Italic Angle). Also it adds dots around the nodes to indicate the horizontal direction of node movement for angle correction.

packages.name: PencilTool.glyphsPlugin
packages.title: Pencil Tool
packages.description: Draw freely with a pencil-like tool directly in Edit View. Adjust thickness and smoothing using the tool palette.

packages.name: Corretto.glyphsPlugin
packages.title: Corretto Post-Processor
packages.description: *Corretto* is a versatile post-processing plugin that fine-tunes and fixes up your fonts each time you export them. Developers can add their own post-processing plugins to Corretto. Documentation: <https://corretto.kutilek.de/>

packages.name: BetterVFExport.glyphsPlugin
packages.title: Better VF Export
packages.description: *Better VF Export* modifies the Variable Font export in the *File > Export* dialog. After export, it fixes duplicate `Italic` particles in `fvar` PS Names, and it allows full control over the `STAT` table with `Axis Values` parameters in your Variable Font Setting (in *Font Info > Exports*). See the [documentation in the repo readme](https://github.com/mekkablue/BetterVFExport) for details.

packages.name: Zoom to Selection.glyphsPlugin
packages.title: Zoom to Selection
packages.description: Adds a command in the View menu that allows users to quickly zoom the edit view to the selected range.

packages.name: PencilModifier.glyphsPlugin
packages.title: Pencil Modifier
packages.description: Enhances the Pencil tool with three features: drawing simplified paths, redrawing existing paths, and drawing closed paths.
